Title.evidence: Background: Prehabilitation constitutes a multidisciplinary strategy aimed at optimizing patientsâ€™ physiological and psychological status prior to surgery, with the objective of improving postoperative outcomes and long-term quality of life.

Intervention.evidence: Interventions commonly include structured exercise programs, nutritional optimization, respiratory muscle training, and psychosocial support.

Objective.evidence: with the objective of improving postoperative outcomes and long-term quality of life.

Result_Outcome.evidence: Overall, 82% of included studies reported statistically significant improvements in surgical outcomes associated with prehabilitation.
